title: [BUG]  SKRect to WPF Rect is incorrect
body:
**Description**

SkiaSharp.Views.WPF.WPFExtensions

**Code**

SKRect skrect = new SKRect(left: 5, top: 5, right: 15, bottom: 15);
Rect rect = skrect.ToRect();

**Expected Behavior**

rect.Right = 15 and rect.Bottom = 15

**Actual Behavior**

rect.Right = 20 and rect.Bottom = 20

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  2.88.3
- Last known good version:  don't know
- IDE:  Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- all that apply, remove the platforms that aren't broken or haven't had any testing -->
  - Windows Classic: WPF, .NET Framework 4.8
- Target Devices: 
  - Windows PC
  
<details>
  <summary>Detailed IDE/OS information (click to expand)</summary>
public static Rect ToRect(this SKRect rect) returns new System.Windows.Rect by its constructor call.
Its prototype accepts x, y, width and heigth parameters but your call is: new Rect(rect.Left, rect.Top, rect.Right, rect.Bottom);
As result I get incorrect rectangle.
</details>
